channel.title: Giving a .html document you made a domain?
channel.description:
I've been really getting into html. I wanted to know how to make it so that the html document I made from a notepad could be a site. I Googled it, Asked it, and no help. Please don't tell me to just use a site maker like Freewebs and just insert the document :(
What I mean...
I want to get the .html document onto the internet, instead of the location being C:\Bla\Bla\Bla.html and make it a www.bla._
~Lin

item.title: Giving a .html document you made a domain?

item.description:
@mod_robby wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:3, topic:113096”]Filezilla is a pretty sexy FTP client as well (Nice and simple… all I need).[/quote]thats also what i do…Works great!

item.title: Giving a .html document you made a domain?
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

upload it to a site. like freewebs, fourtune city, go to google and search free web host. and upload your files there.
does that answer your question?

or buy a domain and host and upload it with a ftp program. smartFTP or Dreamweaver.

Read full topic
